chat.msg: hi there, empezamos?
si hola empiezas desde el mapa
great
I am at the starting point, next to a path that leads to a small island with a tiger. Where am I heading?
up in between the bird and the elephant towards the frog
Muy bien, nos dirigimos hacia la isla grande con el loro y el elefante, luego nos fuimos a la isla con la rana.
¿que sigue?
despues de la rana cruza sobre el cocodrilo hacia la roca y la giraffe
de acuerdo, pasamos la rana, cruzamos sobre el cocodrilo y estamos en la roca al lado de la jirafa
¿ahora que hacemos?
from the giraffe cruza sobre la snake directo al treasure
got it, pasamos de la girafa a la serpiente y hemos llegado al tesoro
*finished* turns out this wasn't that heavy after all, eh?

chat.msg: hey!!! ya comenzamos?
si
perfect! Now, from our friend the white dog, head a little to the left, passing under a wooden bench and crossing a path until you reach near a flower stand
Okay Im at the flower stand, where to now?
¡lindo! Ahora debes girar rápidamente en U a la izquierda, cruzando el camino nuevamente hacia donde está nuestro amigo el perro blanco.
Es como un pequeño desvío, ¿sabes?
puedes decirmelo de otra manera
clear! From the flower stand, turn around and take the path you just crossed, go in the opposite direction to the white dog
ok im at the white dog once more... where to now?
¡excelente! ahora sigue hacia abajo en el mapa, pasando por encima de una rama, hasta llegar a otro perro blanco hermano del primero.
este está junto a un mantel de picnic a cuadros rojos y blancos
ok estoy con el otro perro con su mantel de picnic, ahora a donde?
ahora, continua tu camino hacia abajo sobre el mantel de picnic y encuentra un tazón lleno de bayas
te va a servir de guía para seguir hacia la izquierda, al oeste
despues de los fishees, hacia donde?
después de la deliciosa parada de bayas, encontrarás una rama de madera que cruza el río, debes seguirla hacia arriba (norte)

chat.msg: hey, estas listo?
si, we start from the tent downwards under the dog and above the fire
ok, estoy caminando hacia el sur, pasando el pielrojo junto al fuego
¿cual es el próximo paso, amigo?
from the fire you stand near the car but go back downwards to the path hacia el telescope
¡comprendido! camino hacia el sur, dejando el coche azul a mi derecha hasta llegar al telescopio azul
¿y ahora qué?
te vas por abajo del telescope hacia la casita
avanzó hacia el sud hasta la casa rodeada de rocas
¡misión cumplida, amigo! *finished* ¿qué sigue?

chat.msg: hola, q tal? ready to play?
si
awesome! ok, slip under that first palm tree in front of you and turn right. pass the second one, then make a sharp left before hitting the third palm
go straight south. got it?
Im at the third palm from the left where to now?
¡limpio! Ahora querrás moverte hacia la izquierda de ese lindo cachorro marrón que ves.
Una vez allí, gire un poco hacia la izquierda, luego hacia la derecha y luego hacia el sur. ¿entendido?
desde el dog hacia donde?
directo al sur, amigo! just make sure to avoid the puppy's tail
it's wagging pretty hard over there!
directo al sur a donde, despues de el perro?
go towards the stones, a big one on your left and a small one on your right
towards the ocean that is right in front of you. You see it?
ok im at the ocean between the large and big stone, where to now?
perfecto! Ahora localiza ese cangrejo rojo en el agua, míralo y gira a la derecha.
quédate en la gran roca y sigue avanzando hacia el oeste. ¿Te parece bien eso?
dimelo en ingles por favor estoy en el ocean con the red crab
sure, no problem! now, keep going west in the water alongside that big rock you see
on it?
went west along the big rock where to now?
¡bonita! Ahora sigue nadando hasta que veas una roca mediana y un tiburón.
¡Gira bruscamente a la derecha tan pronto como lo hagas!
estoy near the tiburon ahora donde?
alright! now get back to the land, head between that medium rock and the colourful ball
keep heading north
ok im where the ball is where to now?
¡súper! ahora, gira un poco a tu izquierda, en dirección noroeste
Cruzarás entre una carpa roja y un gran altavoz.
estoy entre the tent and the speaker where to now?
awesome, my friend! now, make a nice arc around the red tent
go a bit south towards the sea from there
after going around the tent where to
dirígete hacia la orilla pero detente justo antes de tocar el agua. Luego, haz un giro brusco a la derecha.
Verás un kayak rojo. ¡ve allí!

general_survey.answer: I moved to the U.S.A. and we lived with people who spoke English a lot and is part of how I learned from the age of 7 and became more fluent around the age of 10.
general_survey.question: Have you ever lived in a home environment or country where your second language was spoken? If so, please explain briefly:
On a day-to-day basis, how likely are you to have a conversation using both your first and second languages?
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? At work
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? At home
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? Interacting with friends
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? Interacting with family
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? Using social media
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? To accommodate people who don't share the same language or language fluency.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? For social reasons; one language feels more appropriate.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? I can't think of a word in the current language.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? The word in the other language just fits better.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? It's an accident, or I don't realize I'm doing it.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? I'm more comfortable discussing the topic in the other language.
Do you enjoy mixing languages in conversation?

general_survey.answer: I think it makes sense to do it if you know the people are actually going to understand and if it's done more privately. Speaking Spanglish in public seems kind of rude to me.
general_survey.question: What do you think when others mix languages in conversation? Please explain:

general_survey.answer: Spoke spanish natively from birth, at the age of 7 moved to the U.S. and started learning english. Then by age 10 I was using both languages, english mostly at school and more spanish at home.
general_survey.question: Any final comments about your language background?
